page.title: 02THE CHURCH
page.content:
The Church.
Methwold Church was built in the 14th century by an unknown builder. The church has a choir, an organ and a organist.The church is 500 years old.The windows are very old and are called perpendicular windows. The church building materials are flint and stone also pieces of concrete.On the windows are pictures of Mary and Jesus also of the star the shepherds and the animals.The colours in the windows are green,red,purple,blue,pink,brown, yellow,black,white,burgandy and orange.The bells in the tower were removed because the frame work would not hold the bell's weight.The church has a damaged brass .The church has had one vandal but luckly nothing was taken.
